fr.lipn.nlptools.utils.align
Class SimpleTokenByLineReader

java.lang.Object
  fr.lipn.nlptools.utils.align.AnnotatedTextReader
      fr.lipn.nlptools.utils.align.SimpleTokenByLineReader

public class SimpleTokenByLineReader
extends AnnotatedTextReader

This AnnotatedTextReader reads input from a Reader object where annotations are provided line by line, i.e. each line has the form: "<token> <annot 1>...<annot N>" processNextToken(InputReader, AlignerConsumer) will send only the information line by line: the first non-whitespace sequence in the line is considered as the token, and the remaining of the line are sent as the annotation. This AnnotatedTextReader can be used with any kind of java.io.Reader (file, string, etc.)

Author:
moreau

DEFAULT_SEPARATOR_REGEX

public static final java.lang.String DEFAULT_SEPARATOR_REGEX
See Also:
Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SimpleTokenByLineReader

public SimpleTokenByLineReader(java.io.BufferedReader reader,
                               java.lang.String separatorRegex,
                               FilterTokenAndAnnot filter,
                               java.lang.String additionalLineSeparatorRegex)
Detailed constructor.

Parameters:
reader - the reader from which annotated text is read
separatorRegex - the regular expression describing the separator to consider. if null, default regex is used (non-empty sequence of whitespaces)
filter - An object implementing FilterTokenAndAnnot, which is used to pre-process some special cases. It is called in processNextToken(InputReader, AlignerConsumer) before calling InputReader.receiveTokenAndAnnotation(AlignerConsumer, String, String), thus this object is able to remove/transform the token and annotation that were read. null = do not use.
additionalLineSeparatorRegex - An additional "line separator", in other words a regexp describing some separator which sould be interpreted as a newline (i.e. a frontier before a new token). Notice that new lines are always such separators, even in this case. null = do not use.

processNextToken

public void processNextToken(InputReader inputReader,
                             AlignerConsumer alignerConsumer)
                      throws AlignmentException
tries to find the first separator in the line, then consider the left part as the token (blanks prefix is removed if necessary) and the right part as the annotation. Filtering can be used with FilterTokenAndAnnot NB: Sends null token and null annot for each empty line (or line starting with whitespaces): since empty lines are generally used as sentence separator, the receiver thus knows where these separators are.

Specified by:
processNextToken in class AnnotatedTextReader
Throws:
AlignmentException
